Class FieldTest

java.lang.Object
FieldTest
Direct Known Subclasses:
FieldTestFailure
public class FieldTest
extends java.lang.Object
A specialized way to build a specific test case for a Field. Fields are then compared for equality by invocation of the assertEquality method.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.lang.String fieldName
    The name of this field
    private java.lang.Class<?> fieldType

    private int[] modifiers
    The modifier(s) of this field

      the modified FieldTest object.

      public FieldTest setFieldType​(java.lang.Class<?> fieldType)
      Set the expected field type for a field.
      Parameters:
      fieldType - the class representative of the type of this field.
      Returns:
      the modified FieldTest object.

    • addModifier

      private void addModifier​(java.lang.String modifierName)
      Adds an expected modifier to the FieldTest.
      Parameters:
      modifierName - the modifier to expect

    • setModifiers

      public FieldTest setModifiers​(java.lang.String[] modifierNames)
      Adds an expected set of modifiers to the MethodTest
      Parameters:
      modifierNames - the modifiers to expect.
      Returns:
      the MethodTest with the newly built expected modifiers.

    • build

      public FieldTest build()
      A build method to satisfy the method contract of a builder framework.
      Returns:
      the built FieldTest.

    • getNamedModifiers

      private java.lang.String[] getNamedModifiers()
      Get a String array of modifiers representative of the modifiers that the method that the MethodTest object represents.
      Returns:
      A modifier list of the modifiers applicable to the method

    • assertEquality

      public TestingTuple assertEquality​(FieldTest fieldTest)
      Determine if equality exists between two FieldTest objects. Invoke this method from the expected object, and pass the actual object to it.
      Parameters:
      fieldTest - The field to test equality against.
      Returns:
      a boolean value indicative of if the two Fields are equal.

    • observeModifier

      private void observeModifier​(java.lang.String modifierName)
      Updates the modifier array with the given state for its given name. Modifiers are organized in the array in the following fashion.

      [0] -> public [1] -> private [2] -> protected [3] -> static [4] -> final [5] -> transient [6] -> abstract [7] -> native [8] -> interface [9] -> strict [10] -> synchronized [11] -> volatile

      Parameters:
      modifierName - The modifier name to set, in all lowercase.
